reviews.review_text: The food were very delicious.  We got 2 Royal bento boxes, vegetarian udon soup, and a kids meal.  They were all very yummy.  Very great vibes .  Roof top patio and friendly staff.  Next time I do want to try the different items on the menu as they looked so good for the other tables.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit and great review!! We look forward to serving you soon!!

reviews.review_text: This restaurant is a hidden gem! It took us a while to find the entry. They have a sign on ground floor says it s opened, however, there s no sign on second floor, so we kind of feel lost and don t know where it is. Once we went up to third floor, we found the restaurant and everything is so amazing! They have a really Japanese style interior decoration which is cute and aesthetic. We ordered 3 combos and every food is tasty! Really recommend the royal bento, it s $30 but you got to try so many dishes! Will definitely recommend to others and come back!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato gozaimasu for your visit. We are glad you found us!! We are looking forward to seeing you soon!

reviews.review_text: Had a wonderful lunch at Haraheri Customer service: The staff is welcoming and provided excellent service. Food: Haraheri Bento Box: this was super tasty! Everything in this Bento box had good flavour and textures. Items incuded: chicken nanban, cauliflower karaage, wagyu hamburg steak, ingen fries, ebi fries, bang bang g salad, vegetable pickles & kobachi Setting: Tranquil rooftop patio seating was perfect on a sunny day. Definitely would return to try out the other menu items.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for the great review. Please come again!

reviews.review_text: Good food especially the karage chicken omg I dream about this fried chicken with the mayo dip. The hand roll was meh but I tried a few bites of steak from my friends and cocktails are bombbbbbb. Will definitely come back again. My heart goes out to the servers tryna serve our table of 11 tho but we all got chicken and beers so we re g.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your feedback. We apologize for our service and we will try our best to serve you better on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: I came around 2 pm on Wednesday the service a and the attendant was amazing no complains but the best part was the food totally Japanese; recommended from a Japanese person. I try the curry with noodles and was nice till the moment of the oden 5 kinds arrive a perfect combination of flavours and textures I like to call it the sea earth dish
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your compliments!! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit. Please come again~

reviews.review_text: Delicious food, especially the karaage. Mocktails, cocktails, and beer were good. Patio seating is lovely with the lights. Floor seating is also an option. Great for both casual dinners and special occasions. A busy place in a not-so-busy area. Chatter is not too loud.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for sharing!! We will try our best to serve you better on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: Our local friends told us this place is sister restaurant to Guu with Garlic and that they actually like this place better. So we tried it out, and my goodness, it was so worth it. Granted, you have to order a bunch of dishes because they re kind of small, but that s izakaya for you. We loved everything, esp the sukiyaki and salmon ikura bowl. Spent about $127 pre tax for 9 dishes and sake which is very decent.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato gozaimasu for your visit and feedback! We will try our best to serve you better on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: Nice spot for some social bites and drinks. The food was great and the service was excellent. I was quite surprised how reasonable the bill turned out considering how much we ate and drank. Worth checking out.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit and feedback! We will try our best to serve you better on you next visit.

reviews.review_text: Love visiting here whenever Im in the mood for some Japanese food downtown. It used to be a Guu, but has now changed its name. I love the food, the atmosphere and the staff are attentive but not overbearing. Highly recommended the Brussels sprouts and the karaage both the chicken and cauliflower styles. For the special when I was there they were offering black cod collar which was delicious. Me and my dining partner throughly enjoyed each dish. I will return.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your great comments! We are looking forward to serving you soon!!

reviews.review_text: A neat little eatery on a roof with a wide selection of izakaya treats. You can order and pay on your phone at your seat, some dishes even come with a discount if you do. All the dishes are reasonably priced and even on the cheaper end. I really loved the blend of flavors in the cool eggplant and the black cod was so fatty and tender and generously portioned! I also really enjoyed my melon drink and ice cream, very creamy and refreshing. Service was nice and very fast, we couldve been in and out in 45 minutes with how fast the kitchen was, although we ate a bit earlier during dinner when it wasnt as busy, the speed was still rather impressive.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for a great comment! We apologize that we couldnt  reply for long time. We are looking forward to serving you soon!!

reviews.review_text: I visited the restaurant on a Thursday night. The place wasnt too crowded and we got a seat by the bar immediately. This was my second time visiting and they rebrand the restaurant from Guu to the current one. The ambience is still nice like previously. You order from your phone and they bring it to your table. Not a huge fan of needing to pay and tip before eating tho. The food itself was unique and flavorful. You cant find some of their dishes from other sushi store/Izakaya. We ordered pork neck, fish collar bone, roasted cauliflower, karage and mackerel pressed sushi. The pork neck and beer tonge were amazing. The karage had crunchy skin and the inside was tender and juicy. Definitely recommend checking this place out.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your comment for our food!! It alsways encourage us to make our restaurant better! We are working on our order-to-table system to let you pay after the dinner. Hopefully, it will be available on your next visit. We are looking forward to serving you soon!! Arigatou Gozaimasu!!

reviews.review_text: Tasty Japanese food and warm service. Really a cozy place to have meal and hang out with friends. A little situation we encountered was that we left a pair of sunglasses at the restaurant after dinner. The owner patiently helped mail them to our place in another city. Highly appreciated!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your visit. We appreciate your comments. Please come again!

reviews.review_text: Rebrand from Guu Garden so the menu is completely different from before. Still a great place for snacks and drinks with friends or dates. Huge outdoor space with patio seatings on the top floor of the complex. Stairways on the sides for entry to reach to the upper floors. The restaurant has an online ordering system, it is also a great way to list out the items you want to order in person without needing to repeat it to the staff. The foods were great aside from one of the dishes of chicken, thou it was deep fried but the sauce and such made it soggy.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your supportive comment! We also appreciate your honest opinion about the chicken dish. We will try to fix the problem and serve you better on your next visit. Arigato!

reviews.review_text: Amazing experience at Haraheri last night! We went on a Friday and we were helped immediately. The restaurant has a cute rooftop vibe and the inside is quite cozy. What I was impressed by, however, was their great level of service and AMAZING, authentic japanese food. The tuna tataki was divine - garlic chips added a nice twist. Chicken karaage was yummy too. The best part of my night was the cajun salmon aburi/oshi - it literally melted in your mouth and the flavours worked perfectly. Absolutely loved it. Staff was extremely friendly & prices were reasonable considering Covid! I will definitely be returning. :)
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your compliments!! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit.

reviews.review_text: Come on by for rooftop patio dining @guuharden.  The tables are socially distanced and the weather was perfect for dining outside in May 2021.  I really liked the garden around the patio which reminds me of Japan. Its the 2nd time Ive seen this system at a restaurant, ordering from your smartphone.  Such a great system to use to minimize contact as well, I am sure it helps the staff with orders going. straight to the kitchen. We both order the lunch Royal bento box and was delighted my it arrived.  Everything looked appetizing with bright colours and organized placement in the bento box with attention to detail. The Royal bento box includes: - 3 kinds of sashimi - ebi mayo - chicken and cauliflower karaage - ingren fries - bang bang e salad - saba shima sushi - grilled fish - vegetable kobachi - miso soup. My favourite were the fresh sashimi, specifically salmon and scallops.  They both melted in the mouth and you knew they were fresh.  The rest of of the items, honestly was also delicious.  The shrimp was super big and juicy in the ebi mayo.  The chicken was boneless and super moist and crunchy on the outside.  I enjoy vegetables with the bang bang e salad, cauliflower karaage and vegetable kobachi.  I was wasnt able to finish as I was quite full.  My husband gladly finished the rest of mine. If you havent tried Guu Garden, you must!  Support local by dining in (patio) or pickup/delivery.

This is one of my favourite Japanese restaurants in downtown! Their service is great! The food is very intricate and flavourful. During covid time, they have QR code on their table that allows you to order and pay through your phone. I love the thought they put in designing their outdoor dining experience. They have heater, pretty lighting and a nice view.

It was my first time dinned at this place. All the dishes were delicious but maybe because this restaurant business was very good on that particular Sunday night. I hardly can hear my friends talking across the table  I will return other days to try the food again.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your compliment on our food and apologize for any inconveniences during your visit. We will try our best to manage it and serve you better on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: The thing I loved the most about Eat Bar & Patio Haraheri is the way the space itself is setup. The entire restaurant feels like a rooftop patio (half of which is actually a rooftop patio). Even when youre inside, it almost feels like youre outside because of the wall to ceiling sliding glass doors. The staff were also super friendly. They had a great big smile as they welcomed us into/ushered us out of the restaurant. The food was delicious and prompt. I can recommend the Chicken Karage, the duck breast, Nasu Agebitashi, Bang Bang G Salad, and the Sake Sangria. Great spot to enjoy a nice summer day with friends and good eats.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your feedback!! Please come again!!

reviews.review_text: We re a fan of the Guu family for 2 decades now and we ve had consistently fantastic izakaya experience at Guu Garden. Our go-to dishes every time are their agedashi mozzarella , tuna tataki, duck, pork cheek, and yaki udon. Never had a mediocre dish and service has always been on point. These guys switched to takeouts seamlessly during covid and we were so grateful we had this as an option! So glad we were able to dine at Guu Garden before they shutdown for reno/rebranding. Looking forward to their re-opening.

Amazing 3rd floor large secluded patio and food was deliciois. Nice variety, lots of vegetarian and carnivore options, and easy to share. Service was friendly and really efficient. They also had some larger tables that could easily accommodate a larger group of 8-10 people. Perfect summer time spot.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for sharing!

reviews.review_text: Out of all the Guus in Vancouver I think this one is the best. I love that their situated above street level. It s got a bit of drama when you walk up the steps to their entrance. I ve come here for both dinner and lunch but come here more often for lunch. Their lunch menu is sooooo good. I ve had all their lunch specials and my favorite is the steak one. You can add the egg to it as well as a slightly larger portion of steak, if you re feeling super hungry. The normal one is pretty generous and comes w rice, soup, pickled veggie, and salad. their izakaya one is also really good and my second favorite, as that one offers nice variety. Price is not bad for downtown sushi set lunches. they do have $10 rice bowls as well. So a good range of items depending how much you want to spend.

One of the finest Japanese restaurant in Vancouver. I love the lunch menu, especially the sukiyaki, taste and portion are perfect for me. Several choice of cocktails and sake. Warm sake is also another favorite one for myself. The location is alright. Some chairs are not that comfortable but still acceptable. Definitely need to make reservations for dinner, it s usually full.

Came here fairly late at night in the rain with my family, so there wasnt too many other people there when I was here. That being said, service was fairly attentive and very polite with us. Well now that we got that part out the way.. The food was pretty damn good. We got six regular size plates and whew, they really hit all the right notes. I have a particular fondness for all things uni, so the baby scallop and uni cream croquette was just icing all over a very moist cake. We also ordered pork cheek, miso calamari, nankotsu, agedashi tofu and black cod kama. Presentation of each dish is pleasing, considering theyre mostly small fried plates, and they came out at a decent speed. Gotta say, nothing I didnt like at this place. Its not mind blowingly good, but they do everything so solidly its hard not to give them a 5.

Very nice izakaya, good interior design and tasty dishes. The beef tongue is definitely recommend. Portion sizes were a bit small but is expected regarding the price. However, the online ordering system could be adjusted; paying the tips after receiving service would be better.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for you supportive comment and your opinion about our online system. Our tech team is working hard to make that happen. We are hoping the feature would be available soon. We will try our best to serve you better on your next visit!! Arigato!!

reviews.review_text: Ive been coming to Guu Garden for many years now, and am amazed at their ability to change their menu regularly to incorporate seasonal fare, while maintaining a few delicious staples. This location in particular does an amazing New Years lunch set that they have also changed nearly every year (this year it featured a huge lobster tail as the highlight). The location is also wonderful, especially in the summertime when the rooftop patio seating is available. Due to the size of the surrounding buildings, and the less than obvious route to get there, it always feels like a bit of a secret location.

Always love Guu restaurant no matter which one it is. This one is unique, it has a massive patio however it s a shame that it is not well utilized and decorated. They could have an amazing rooftop patio vibe but I guess they didn t put any efforts into that. Anyway, food is not bad. It is a bit weird to that you have to pre-pay your order when ordering thru the their online menu. It is hard to split between friends and hard to determine the tip because I hardly even got any food or service yet.
Hidden little gem Downtown. I would totally gatekeep but I wont!  Delicious food and a great atmosphere.  Sashimi super fresh!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato gozaimasu for finding us! We are looking forward to serving you soon!

reviews.review_text: A wonderful gem, tucked away. Tanaka-San curated a fantastic menu for our group of 16; delicious food, great wine and impeccable service.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for stars!! We look forward to serving again!

reviews.review_text: Everything I visit Guu Garden, I am always amazed by how they are always consistent in their ability to excite me. The food offers a good variety of Izakaya classics as well as delicious creative takes on classic tapas as well. This is a place meant to go in groups to order as large a variety as possible. Already wanting to go back!
Best karaage Ive had in years. The salmon oishi was really good too! Will definitely be back. Thank you so much for the amazing service and hospitality!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit and a great feedback. We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: We preordered bento boxes which was good idea! But I wish there were less deep fried dishes.   Good atmosphere and friendly staff.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit and feedback. We will keep trying our best to serve you better on your visit!!

reviews.review_text: Went here for lunch on Sunday. Loved it. I ordered the chirashi with marinated sashimi and raw shrimp.  Came with a chawanmushi and miso soup. My wife had the special work the spaghetti and fresh mussels.  Great food at great value.

Excellent izakaya restaurant! The dishes are all delicious, packed with flavour and well presented. Prices are excellent! Service is great, very helpful. The salmon oshi was one of my favorite dishes, the brown rice was a nice twist! The ebi mayo was my second favorite, perfectly cooked and lightly battered!

I booked a party for 16 people for a birthday party. I even checked ahead of time if the bills can be split and it wasnt any issue. At the end of the night, we just put it on one bill, but I appreciated the owners patience for all the multiple questions I had. When we got there, I realized I forgot to mention that we wanted to sit outside, but since there were open tables, they gladly accommodated us. The outdoor space was beautiful and didnt feel like we were downtown, but on a rooftop little oasis. The food and drinks came out at a wonderful pace, without over crowding the table but not too slow where we were waiting too long either. There were too many dishes to name, but the stand outs were the tuna tataki, salmon oishii, beef tongue in broth with rice, grilled beef tongue, mentaiko pasta, tako wasa and salmon sashimi. We were having such a good time I forgot to take pictures. The staff here are amazing, so nice and we never felt rushed.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your visit and give great comments! We will try our best to serve best on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: Ate here our first evening in Vancouver. The restaurant was crowded, but the servers work hard to provide us with great services. Many great option on the menu. The food were excellent.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato gozaimasu for sharing!! Please come again!!

reviews.review_text: great service, great attitude, serviced me the wrong food and the manager, the waitress came out and showed deep and sincere apology with good attitude. They treat their customers very well.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for sharing your experience and gave us another chance! We look forward to serving you soon!!

reviews.review_text: Everyone must have their lunch! Preorder and they give %10 off! I saved $5.5 therefore lol
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit! We are looking forward to serving you again!!

reviews.review_text: This is a great Japanese fusion restaurant that is part of the Guu Family of restaurants in Vancouver. They have great cocktails like the Frozen Sake Bellini. The service is very good and arrives quickly. The restaurant is usually very busy, so you may want to get a reservation.
Great izakaya. Would recommend the duck breast, takara plum wine, salmon oshi sushi, cauliflower, creamy udon
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato gozaimasu for great pictures!! We are looking forward to serving you again!!

reviews.review_text: Guu Garden is a unique and memorable experience every time I eat there. The usual dishes I order include: Nasu (ginger-soy marinated eggplant), Mekyabetsu (deep-fried brussel sprouts), and Gin Kama Grill (cod cheek), all equally delicious in their own right. However, I recommend not limiting yourself to just these three dishes, as they have many to offer, which you should check out. This place is a must for food lovers who are visiting Vancouver!
This place was missing only one thing customers. It is a shame it wasn t full. It should be everyday. Ridiculously inexpensive, great tasting, awesome location
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your feedback! It encourages us to keep what we are doing and we appreciate that. Please come again!

reviews.review_text: Great lunch options. The Bento boxes were delicious. Oden, chicken bang bang salad, yaki udon were amazing. During the patio dining only, the servers were very good. They have a great online ordering system so you dont have to go though any payment machine but rather on your own phone. That is very amazing now a days. Staff and food A+++
Great food and comfy rooftop spot.  Left my jacket and waitress found me about to cross the street to return it - a 5 Star in my books
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit. We are looking forward to serving you soon!

reviews.review_text: So delicious! All their plates are top notch and they even have their own ale! They have a lot of daily specials to try. Try the chicken knee! I thought their desserts were only so so.
Great food and atmosphere. Service is top notch. Perfect spot to enjoy patio weather!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit and a great review! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: The dishes here are consistently delicious. We really enjoy the pork cheek every time. We tried two new dishes which were the ribs and the yuzu cod which were both amazing. Service was really nice too as they give you a hot towel when you arrive just like in Japan. Remains our go to for izakaya.
I m literally satisfied!!!! The food the service the ambiance just can t be better!!! I love everything they serve and I didn t leave any food in any plate. This place is amazing!!!

Recently came here again and was thoroughly impressed, especially with their lunch menu options. I had the Royal Bento Box, which came with three kinds of sashimi (scallop, shrimp, salmon), ebi mayo, chicken karaage, cauliflower tempura, saba shima sushi, grilled fish, and a few Japanese appetizer bites. It was a great portion for a wholesome lunch, beautifully prepared!
Great cozy patio and interior. We ordered tuna tataki and it was fantastic and also the cheesecake was mind blowing.

My fd took me here for lunch, if u call 30mins before, u will get discount. When u get there, the food is prepared. So if u dont want to wait, and just call in and get discounts!!! The staffs are friendly and nice. The food is very good!! The sashimi is fresh. The royal bento box I got, the tempera is amazing, I really love it! Enjoy our lunch!
The cocktails are SO GOOD! And their vegan creamy udon pasta is soooo delicious. Love it here.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your comment!! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!! Arigato!!

reviews.review_text: Food was beautiful and delicious.  Staff were friendly and unassuming.  A gem for sure.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit!!

reviews.review_text: Good place for japanese. A lot of not as popular food like squid pasta or wasabi octopus. The rice a little bit overcooked but everything else is perfect
A hidden Japanese gem with a lovely rooftop patio. Excellent food, wonderful atmosphere, and polite, friendly and efficient staff.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato gozaimasu for your visit! We will try our best to serve you best on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: Come here for the 24oz Mega Sapporos and amazing small plates. Sashimi here is expensive. However, the quality reflects the price. If you do get shrimp sashimi, you can ask them to deep fry the shrimp heads after you eat the shrimp body. Their oden was particularly good.

This my second time visiting Guu Garden. The food here punch above its price point. It is not flashy compare to new comers like Raisu, but it delivers great taste and value. If you are ever unsure of what to order, I recommend the Izakaya Lunch Box, and get a beer while you are at

Excellent food. Very popular. Noisy. Accessibility is a bit confusing. Elevator access via an adjacent building is available but no signage to indicate that. Many steps to climb, which is difficult for some would be patrons. Staff are very attentive. Note... Two-hour seating limit for busy times. These details could easily be included in their website.
Dine out 2020 was great. Good food seletions and decent price ($25). One of the few restaurants that is worth of going during Dine out.

Delicious food, very reasonable prices, attentive service, classy big band jazz music, authentic Japanese dining experience, what more could you ask for? For value, go for the lunch menu and call in  a preorder 30 minutes ahead of time for 10% off.
Food is good, sashimi is fresh , place is not busy .
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your compliments!

reviews.review_text: Ive been here twice for dinner and twice for lunch, and was delighted with the food and service each time. Staff are polite, friendly, and attentive. The cream udon was perfectly done - very umami - and my personal favourite is the tamagoyaki oden, which I think is only available during lunch. It melts in your mouth and is perfect on a cold, winter day. I also love that there is plenty of patio space, which can accommodate large groups. I highly recommend this place. Parking: Paid underground parking available.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for a great review! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: I had a great experience here. The staff are welcoming and really know the menu. The food was excellent as well. The feet warmers under the table are a very nice perk as well. I would go back just for that. Dietary restrictions: I am gluten free and the staff took it very seriously. I found I had lots of options as well.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato gozaimasu for your great feedback!! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit.

reviews.review_text: Good amount of food,creative dishes,competitive price with great quality of food:)I love this Izakaya.
The food compliment the drinks so well my asian glow was on FIREEEE
Best Japanese food in town Its real Japanese restaurant, not  Korean  Japanese restaurant. They also have great price for the beer.
Another hidden gem in Vancouver! Would definitely come back. Roof deck view Classy place
Really enjoy the whole lunch, excellent customer service, food is very very good.
I loved everything they served here, I truly recommend this spot! I d like to come back for the takoyaki and mackerel oshizushi! The atmosphere is super nice! Loved the Zashiki style tables.

I hosted my 32nd birthday here.  Weeks before my event, they were prompt to reply and were communicative throughout the whole procedure. During the night, they on-the-fly accommodated my extra seats.  The service was excellent, and the food was good.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your visit on your 32nd birthday and sharing your experience. We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: Best prawns Ive ever had. Have to get them in season (May) but the food and atmosphere is wonderful.
Tasty, tasty food here!! Service was quick and attentive! Will be back again! The smoked mackerel was flavourful and fresh!
This place is a hidden gem. Bartender is so cool. Love the food. Wish I had known this spot earlier. You should visit if you are staying at Sheraton.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato you very much for finding us and give us a chance to serve you. We are looking forward to seeing you soon!

reviews.review_text: Great spot for lunch and huge patio for the summer. Mega 1L bzzrs....Basically 3 bzzrs for $9. Service always with a smile. *Tip* phone in your lunch order ahead of time and receive a few bucks off per entree.

Best chicken karaage ever. All the dishes were delicious, service was great. Tako wasabi was good, but I think octopus could be marinated a bit longer to make it a bit more tender. Cool location, would come again.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit and compliment!! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: Really nice patio for summer. One of the best Izakaya I try in Vancouver.

I m glad we stumbled into this restaurant a few nights ago! The food was wonderful and served quickly by attentive staff. We are already planning to go back for the oden, mushroom udon and G Bang salad!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit and planning for another! We will try our best to serve you better on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: Nice place. They need better management of the items still available from the menu
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your advice. We will try our best to serve you better on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: One of the few places I was able to make a reservation for 13 people on Christmas day in Vancouver. That already says something about how accommodating they are. As soon as we entered, we were greeted with loud welcomes from all the staff and seated prompt. The seating where you had to take off your shoes had foot warmers there to keep you warm in the colder winter days. Super nice. The staff would shout orders from right next to you to the bar if needed, so expect that when coming. :) There were a lot of Winter specials when we came and the prices were really fair for the portion. Beef tartar was one of our specials (amazing flavor, nice tender cuts that werent chewy at all). The uni and scallop croquette was nicely fried with such a rich filling. I was looking forward to finally having aburi, so I ordered the salmon off of the original menu. Nice sear on the salmon that complemented the seasoned rice, topped with warm, earthy, slightly spicy spices. So, so good. The mackerel was also really tasty, with a nicely salted fish and seasoned rice. Overall, all of the other dishes were really tasty and I enjoyed everything. The fried cheesecake ice cream was also very tasty, nothing much else like it that I ever had. Highly recommend!
Incredible food for great value!! Super tasty and cosy spot.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for a great comment!! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!

reviews.review_text: Everything we ordered was fantastic.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for your compliments! We are looking forward to serving you soon!!

reviews.review_text: The best sushi Ive eaten. The view is wonderful.

This place is amazing. Definitely on the pricier side of things, but I think the overall experience was worth it. There wasnt a single dish I disliked, out of the 10s of different dishes my party ordered. My only complaint is regarding the propane fireplace placed on the benches for outdoor seating. It got way too hot, and the poor lighting without it may be an issue for those who like taking pictures of their food.
Super friendly staff and good food!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your visit & compliments! Please come again!!

reviews.review_text: We used to go here when it was Guu Garden, and it actually got way better now that the owner took into their own hands and branding. Great atmosphere, great service from the amazing staff and continues to offer delicious Japanese food with lots of variety on the menu for both meat eaters and vegetarians. Will be back for sure.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your continuous support! We are looking forward to serving you soon!!

reviews.review_text: Really good food and very friendly customer services. Highly recommend!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your feedback! Please come again!!

reviews.review_text: Prices were good considering the quality, I really loved the Ebi Mayo and Karaage but I thought the Katsu Curry was okay.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for you feedback! We will try our best to serve you better on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: Love the ambiance, the food and the Last Samurai cocktail <3 make sure to book on a weekend night as its always packed. Awesome for a casual date night as you can share and try all different kinds of food which usually come in small portions. Some vegetarian options available too. Be prepared for servers who yell orders at other! It makes it very fun and unique!

Wow, what a gem! The food here was incredible. Highly recommend it if youre in the area. Will definitely be back. Be sure to try out the duck chashu and get the salted caramel sake ice cream for dessert if available!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Arigato very much for your complaints! We will try our best to serve you even better on your next visit!!

reviews.review_text: Met up with some work friends here for the first time and holy man was this place great! Rooftop views, very popular,  the food was tasty, we shared a bunch of smaller plates and the Saki sangria knocked it out of the park! There is a two hour limit on large tables but they let us stay longer than that which was nice of them if youre looking for a trendy Rooftop patio that serves up premium Japanese food, this is the place. A reservation is a MUST otherwise youre not getting in .

I came in for lunch with an associate, it took a bit to find, it is on the third level in a remarkably serene patio setting. It is a sheltered patio area with cover, it really was beautiful and serene. The service was very good and the food was excellent. We tried a number of things. We shared a sashimi combo, the sashimi was excellent. We also shared a variety of other things, Fluffy fish cakes, cod cheeks, octopus. And the miso soup was excellent.

Friend took me to Guu Garlic and I liked it. So I took the family out to Guu Garden near Air B&B where we stayed. Ordered miso fried squid, fried uni with scallop, pork cheek, black cod Kama (neck), agedashi tofu and two mixed drinks with cold sake. Everything is excellent with the exception of Kama which is on the sweet side but still enjoyable. Portion can be regular or small on some dishes. We had the regular. Meal for 4 is less than $100 Canadian before tip but includes the two drinks. Some complained about the wait but we went at nine and was seated immediately without reservation. They close at twelve.
Delicious and authentic Japanese izakaya place. Very popular though so highly recommend reservations.

I love their regular pub menu(especially Oden!) but also love lunch menu a lot. So many variations from popular Japanese dish, but everything is in their original creative way. It seems nothing is compromised even a simple appetizer. There are some Japanese pubs/restaurants which I can t be proud of, but this is it!

This izakaya serves some of the tastiest sashimi I have ever eaten! Their specials are excellent and creative. Their beer selection is also very convincing. The staff will gladly help non-Japanese speakers figure out the secrets of the menu. What a fantastic place!

I love Guu Garden. They have a wide range of vegan options (which is why I go). Their food is flavourful and their staff is always super friendly. It can get busy though so I would plan to go earlier in the night or make a reservation.

Booked for a Birthday party for 15 people due to the parade we got to the restaurant 30 mins late. good thing they didnt give away our spot which was good. The food was good! specially the pork belly!. The service was good and the waiter even helped us with the cake. The only downside was they took long to give us the bill because it got busy.  Overall, we were satisfied with the restaurant :)
Loved coming here for lunch. My go-to was the chirashi combo. Amazing food!

Nice place to go and hang out with friends or have dinner with your loved one. The staff are pleasant and friendly. They have a good selection of appys and drinks. We ordered chicken karage, squid rings (calamare), tuna tataki, takoyaki and some drinks. Nice Friday evening to end the work week. They have an automated ordering system where you use your smart phone to order and immediately pay for your order. Once youre done, you can just leave. They have a 2hr seating limit which is understandable in this current covid social distancing times. Btw, if you want patio seating, best to make reservations. They open up the patio ceiling/roof if weather permits.

Guu is where you go if youre not sure what you want to eat, but you want to have little bites of interesting, inventive food that isnt too far from your comfort zone. When I look at the menu I have no idea whats going on but everything Ive tried has been surprisingly delicious. I love this place! And of course the staff is extremely friendly and awesome.

Went there on Dec25th and they managed our reservation very well. So glad we found a restaurant opens on Xmas day. The only thing was we like to order 5 miso soup but there were only have 2 left. I understand it since it was a busy day. The Oden is delicious. Everything is in small portion so we can try wide variety of dishes. Polite staff, warm greeting.
